  GeneratedSources: [
    {
      HintName: ErrorOrEndpointAttributes.g.cs,
      Source:
// <auto-generated/>
#nullable enable

namespace ErrorOr
{
    /// <summary>
    /// Marks a static method as an ErrorOr endpoint with explicit HTTP method and route.
    /// Prefer using [Get], [Post], [Put], [Delete], or [Patch] for standard HTTP methods.
    /// </summary>
    [global::System.AttributeUsage(global::System.AttributeTargets.Method, AllowMultiple = false)]
    public sealed class ErrorOrEndpointAttribute : global::System.Attribute
    {
        /// <summary>
        /// Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="ErrorOrEndpointAttribute"/> class.
        /// </summary>
        /// <param name="httpMethod">The HTTP method (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, PATCH, etc.).</param>
        /// <param name="route">The route pattern (e.g., "/api/users/{id}").</param>
        public ErrorOrEndpointAttribute(string httpMethod, string route)
        {
            HttpMethod = httpMethod;
            Route = route;
        }

        /// <summary>Gets the HTTP method.</summary>
        public string HttpMethod { get; }

        /// <summary>Gets the route pattern.</summary>
        public string Route { get; }
    }

    /// <summary>
    /// Marks a static method as an HTTP GET endpoint.
    /// </summary>
    [global::System.AttributeUsage(global::System.AttributeTargets.Method, AllowMultiple = false)]
    public sealed class GetAttribute : global::System.Attribute
    {
        /// <summary>
        /// Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="GetAttribute"/> class.
        /// </summary>
        /// <param name="route">The route pattern (e.g., "/api/users/{id}").</param>
        public GetAttribute(string route)
        {
            Route = route;
        }

        /// <summary>Gets the route pattern.</summary>
        public string Route { get; }
    }

    /// <summary>
    /// Marks a static method as an HTTP POST endpoint.
    /// </summary>
    [global::System.AttributeUsage(global::System.AttributeTargets.Method, AllowMultiple = false)]
    public sealed class PostAttribute : global::System.Attribute
    {
        /// <summary>
        /// Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="PostAttribute"/> class.
        /// </summary>
        /// <param name="route">The route pattern (e.g., "/api/users").</param>
        public PostAttribute(string route)
        {
            Route = route;
        }

        /// <summary>Gets the route pattern.</summary>
        public string Route { get; }
    }

    /// <summary>
    /// Marks a static method as an HTTP PUT endpoint.
    /// </summary>
    [global::System.AttributeUsage(global::System.AttributeTargets.Method, AllowMultiple = false)]
    public sealed class PutAttribute : global::System.Attribute
    {
        /// <summary>
        /// Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="PutAttribute"/> class.
        /// </summary>
        /// <param name="route">The route pattern (e.g., "/api/users/{id}").</param>
        public PutAttribute(string route)
        {
            Route = route;
        }

        /// <summary>Gets the route pattern.</summary>
        public string Route { get; }
    }

    /// <summary>
    /// Marks a static method as an HTTP DELETE endpoint.
    /// </summary>
    [global::System.AttributeUsage(global::System.AttributeTargets.Method, AllowMultiple = false)]
    public sealed class DeleteAttribute : global::System.Attribute
    {
        /// <summary>
        /// Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="DeleteAttribute"/> class.
        /// </summary>
        /// <param name="route">The route pattern (e.g., "/api/users/{id}").</param>
        public DeleteAttribute(string route)
        {
            Route = route;
        }

        /// <summary>Gets the route pattern.</summary>
        public string Route { get; }
    }

    /// <summary>
    /// Marks a static method as an HTTP PATCH endpoint.
    /// </summary>
    [global::System.AttributeUsage(global::System.AttributeTargets.Method, AllowMultiple = false)]
    public sealed class PatchAttribute : global::System.Attribute
    {
        /// <summary>
        /// Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="PatchAttribute"/> class.
        /// </summary>
        /// <param name="route">The route pattern (e.g., "/api/users/{id}").</param>
        public PatchAttribute(string route)
        {
            Route = route;
        }

        /// <summary>Gets the route pattern.</summary>
        public string Route { get; }
    }

    /// <summary>
    /// Documents a custom error that an endpoint may return.
    /// Use this to document Error.Custom() calls for OpenAPI specification.
    /// </summary>
    [global::System.AttributeUsage(global::System.AttributeTargets.Method, AllowMultiple = true)]
    public sealed class ProducesErrorAttribute : global::System.Attribute
    {
        /// <summary>
        /// Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="ProducesErrorAttribute"/> class.
        /// </summary>
        /// <param name="statusCode">The HTTP status code (e.g., 429 for rate limiting).</param>
        /// <param name="errorType">The error type identifier (e.g., "RateLimit.Exceeded").</param>
        public ProducesErrorAttribute(int statusCode, string errorType)
        {
            StatusCode = statusCode;
            ErrorType = errorType;
        }

        /// <summary>Gets the HTTP status code.</summary>
        public int StatusCode { get; }

        /// <summary>Gets the error type identifier.</summary>
        public string ErrorType { get; }
    }

    /// <summary>
    /// Indicates that an endpoint may return HTTP 202 Accepted for async operations.
    /// Typically used with POST/PUT operations that process asynchronously.
    /// </summary>
    [global::System.AttributeUsage(global::System.AttributeTargets.Method, AllowMultiple = false)]
    public sealed class AcceptedResponseAttribute : global::System.Attribute
    {
    }

    /// <summary>
    /// Documents errors that a method may return. Use on interface methods
    /// to enable automatic error type inference through interface calls.
    /// This is the TypeScript-equivalent of union return types for errors.
    /// </summary>
    /// <example>
    /// <code>
    /// interface ITodoService
    /// {
    ///     [ReturnsError(ErrorType.NotFound, "Todo.NotFound")]
    ///     [ReturnsError(ErrorType.Validation, "Todo.Invalid")]
    ///     Task&lt;ErrorOr&lt;Todo&gt;&gt; GetByIdAsync(Guid id);
    /// }
    /// </code>
    /// </example>
    [global::System.AttributeUsage(global::System.AttributeTargets.Method, AllowMultiple = true)]
    public sealed class ReturnsErrorAttribute : global::System.Attribute
    {
        /// <summary>
        /// Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="ReturnsErrorAttribute"/> class.
        /// </summary>
        /// <param name="errorType">The ErrorType enum value (e.g., ErrorType.NotFound).</param>
        /// <param name="errorCode">The error code string (e.g., "Todo.NotFound").</param>
        public ReturnsErrorAttribute(global::ErrorOr.Core.Errors.ErrorType errorType, string errorCode)
        {
            ErrorType = errorType;
            ErrorCode = errorCode;
        }

        /// <summary>
        /// Initializes a new instance for custom error types with HTTP status codes.
        /// </summary>
        /// <param name="statusCode">The HTTP status code for Error.Custom() calls.</param>
        /// <param name="errorCode">The error code string.</param>
        public ReturnsErrorAttribute(int statusCode, string errorCode)
        {
            StatusCode = statusCode;
            ErrorCode = errorCode;
            ErrorType = null;
        }

        /// <summary>Gets the ErrorType enum value (null for custom errors).</summary>
        public global::ErrorOr.Core.Errors.ErrorType? ErrorType { get; }

        /// <summary>Gets the HTTP status code for custom errors (null for standard ErrorTypes).</summary>
        public int? StatusCode { get; }

        /// <summary>Gets the error code string.</summary>
        public string ErrorCode { get; }
    }
}
    }
  ]
}
